column8: The Barisan Nasional Government has always been sincere when giving out aid and it has always ensured that the aid is disbursed promptly, said MCA Youth chief Datuk Chong Sin Woon.He said that the Government delivers on its promises and does not let recipients wait for long periods before they benefit from the Government's assistance.The Deputy Education Minister also rejected allegations that Barisan was slow in giving out assistance, saying that the Barisan Government ensures that funds are readily available so that recipients can immediately cash in their cheques.He said that the Barisan Government managed to hand out aid to over 800 Chinese schools nationwide in just a month, adding that the Government has allocated more than RM100mil for vernacular schools, mission schools and non-Islamic bodies in the country since 2008.Meanwhile, MCA deputy president Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong said that Barisan is able to prove its rivals wrong by consistently delivering on its initiatives.“There are those who say that Chinese or vernacular and mission schools are sidelined, and this is totally not true,” he said.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...6Eox1xJARBPM.99
